channel.title: Hrvoje Šimić's TIL
channel.description: A collection of Hrvoje Šimić's short form articles

item.title: Filtering records with endless ranges
item.description: Ruby 2.6 has added support for endless ranges, which means ranges no longer require the end argument.

item.title: Shorten Github link from the command line
item.description: There's a tool for shortening links from Github that I've known for a while but I imagine not everyone is aware of it.

item.title: From class components to function components with hooks
item.description: I've been using React 16.5.2 context instead of Redux in the super secret app I'm working on, and I appreciate the simplicity improvement. The learning curve is pretty minimal, and there are fewer levels of abstraction. The one thing that was annoying me was the non-optimal ergonomics of the API when consuming the context.

item.title: Refactoring a large case statement
item.description: I'm currently building a gem for converting curl commands to something else, and one early problem I needed to deal with was parsing the curl command arguments.

item.title: Git diff algorithm options
item.description: I've recently refactored a method with a large case statement and wanted to check a diff of the changes.

item.title: Resizing panes in tmux with a shortcut
item.description: I've been using tmux for years now, but I keep forgetting the shortcuts for resizing panes.

item.title: Refactoring with simple polymorphism
item.description: I'm in the process of writing a gem, and I've not been really focused on writing the best possible code, in order to build something in the least amount of time. I now have some time on my hands, so I've decided to try to make it clearer.

item.title: Pretty formatting JSON in Vim
item.description: I've explained how I've discovered json_pp in a previous TIL post, but I've discovered another great tool for the job, with the shorter name.

item.title: Making HTTP requests from Vim
item.description: After discovering that there is a Visual Studio code plugin which enables HTTP requests from inside the editor, I was delighted to find that there's also a Vim plugin for that.

item.title: Pretty formatting JSON
item.description: I've used to use some silly NPM package for pretty formatting of JSON before.
